channel.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
channel.description: How would I retrieve the field modifier of a specified field, i.e. synchronized, volatile, etc?

item.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:13, topic:259646”]Get stuffed frank_. ASM doesn’t have is*() methods and you have to AND the access flags yourself. On the off chance that OP actually wanted to learn how to read access flags themselves and for others who may want to use ASM I posted it.

Now for a rant about this community: One of the few posts I make and I get flamed.[/quote]asm doesnt have it because it doesnt encapsulate anything, if you are messing with bytecode it should he safe to assume that you know how bitfields work. just because it isnt provided doesnt mean you cant make it

enough crying, you get flamed because you are an idiot

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“abrahm2119, post:11, topic:259646”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=342871.msg2651092#msg2651092 date=1233525545]

[quote author=yakman link=topic=342871.msg2651073#msg2651073 date=1233525213]
yes it know, but is it better to call isNative() or to do that ANDing yourself?
[/quote]call isnative, it makes more sense to someone reading it, it doesnt look like shit and the jvm will probably inline it anyway
[/quote]but if it does not, would that not be an extra instruction(INVOKEVIRTUAL).[/quote]and the cost of calling the method

the only reason for you to ever “optimise” that is if you are completely retarded and dont have a clue how to program. bash im looking at you

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
item.dc:creator: @abrahm2119 abrahm2119
item.description:
@abrahm2119 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:7, topic:259646”][quote author=yakman link=topic=342871.msg2650650#msg2650650 date=1233510479]

[quote author=abrahm2119 link=topic=342871.msg2649923#msg2649923 date=1233470081]

boolean isNative = (field.getModifiers() & Constants.ACC_NATIVE) != 0;
[/quote]or simply: boolean isNative = field.isNative();

in the opinion of everyone at this java forum, which way is better?

that sort of thing also turns up in java nio
[/quote]the fuck are you talking about

if you look at the code for isnative, it will probably do exactly what bash said[/quote]yea:

public final boolean isNative() { return (access_flags & Constants.ACC_NATIVE) != 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
item.dc:creator: @abrahm2119 abrahm2119
item.description:
@abrahm2119 wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:2, topic:259646”]field.getModifiers() or field.getAccessFlags() (they are identical in function).
See Constants for a list of access flags (they start with ACC).

This will just return a number, which you will have to check with the access flag constants, but because Field inherits from AccessFlags you can just do field.isPublic(), etc.[/quote]I see.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieving field modifiers
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

field.getModifiers() or field.getAccessFlags() (they are identical in function).
See Constants for a list of access flags (they start with ACC).

This will just return a number, which you will have to check with the access flag constants, but because Field inherits from AccessFlags you can just do field.isPublic(), etc.

Read full topic
